text: If I were a dog, and not your son, my mother, and if I wanted to eat your food, would you say ‘no’ to me then? You would reject me saying, ‘Go away, frightened little boy’ – ‘Go away, mother, go away. I will no longer come out when I call, nor will I let myself be hungry. If I were only a green frog, and not your son, my mother, would you have tied me up so that I would not fly? You would threaten me with your hand, saying, ‘Bad raptor! Every day you're picoteando your chain' Because look, mom, look. I will go into the forest. I will never let you leave me in your arms. FIN
title: Si yo fuera
author: Rabindranath Tagore
